item.title: Python - Regular Expressions and Reticulate
item.description: Here’s something cool that I found: Regular expressions extract information from text by searching for matches of a specific pattern, and I will be exploring the findall() tool today! This function finds all of the matches and returns them as a list of strings that each represents one match. Here is a basic example to find different matches, looking at a string of “abc aab ab acb cab c”.
